intro: Cucumis hirsutus var. major, commonly known as the hairy cucumber, is a vigorous vine native to tropical and subtropical regions. It produces large, hairy, spiny fruits that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in warm climates with well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Its leaves are broad, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The fruit is typically harvested when it turns from green to yellow or orange, depending on the variety.
